JobFullDesc: About the RoleAs the Product Manager for the Menus team, you will develop self-serve tools for merchants, BPO agents, and internal users to ingest, add and manage products sold on Uber Eats. Your long-term mission will be to make it easy for merchants to manage and sell anything. You will build with scale in mind, ensuring that each platform capability works flawlessly for merchants of all types worldwide.What You'll DoConceptualize and build the next-gen platform that will power all commerce on Uber Eats.Build industry-leading menu management tools used by over 250K+ merchants to manage the products they sell on Uber Eats. You will closely work with design, operations, and support teams to ensure new features will address merchant pain points.Build vertical agnostic products that can easily be scaled to new use cases. It should not matter if a merchant is selling food or flowers, the platform you build should be able to handle it with ease.Reduce operational overhead by converting manual processes into platform features. When you build these platform features, you will see them through execution and on-ground needle-moving impact.Work with stakeholders to understand their current needs and future use cases. You will proactively identify and articulate where tech can elevate customer and merchant experiences. You will then build these into scalable products.Basic QualificationsMinimum 4 years of product management experience delivering highly successful and innovative products with your fingerprints all over them - and you're deeply proud of what you've accomplished.Prior experience collaborating with data science, design, and engineering to ship products.A computer science undergraduate degree, hands-on software engineering experience, or experience building complex software products side by side with engineers.Preferred QualificationsPassionate about building businesses, not features. Entrepreneurial experience building and leading businesses, including ownership and optimization of business performance metrics.Ability to deliver on timelines and move quickly with cross-functional teams to execute decisions while maintaining attention to detail.You tackle complex product challenges and simplify them to avoid making them our users and partner's problems.You are biased toward action and a great collaborator. You take a customer-first lens to your work, keeping the needs of various segments in mind.You find a way to get the data you need and whip it into an insightful story with no help. You know how to use this data to make decisions without getting stuck in analysis paralysis.Experience building B2B or Content Management platforms.
